item.title: Venezuela Suffers From a Century-Long Curse. Will the U.S. Inherit It?
item.description: The country’s biggest problem may not be President Trump.

item.title: My Old Friend Might Be Dying. Should I Tell Her I’m Dating Her Ex?
item.description: She’s reached out asking to reconnect. I’ve postponed a meeting, feeling paralyzed.

item.title: Why Are We Still So Afraid of Using the Grumpy Old Period?
item.description: Exclamation marks, ellipses and ‘haha’ can’t fix our growing inability to communicate.

item.title: Trump’s Fight With Minnesota Is About More Than Immigration
item.description: The state embodies a civic ideal that the administration in Washington wants to discredit.

item.title: Should You Use Dryer Lint as Kindling?
item.description: A ruling on the merits of a thrifty life hack.

item.title: Kílian Jornet on What We Can Learn From Pushing Our Bodies to Extremes
item.description: The ultrarunner and mountaineer finds peace through doing unimaginably hard things.

item.title: Was It Wrong to Exclude One Person From Our Family Reunion?
item.description: She got wind of it and is furious.

item.title: How Has Being Perpetually Single Affected You as a Man?
item.description: We want to hear from men over the age of 30 who feel as if they have not yet had a meaningful romantic relationship for a New York Times Magazine feature.

item.title: Chloé Zhao Is Yearning to Know How to Love
item.description: The “Hamnet” director on trying to overcome her deepest fears — and open her heart.

item.title: I Let My Wife Have an Affair. Do I Have to Console Her Now That It’s Over?
item.description: While she is grieving about it, I feel relieved.

item.title: Is It OK to Communicate at Work Using Voice Memos?
item.description: A ruling on office correspondence etiquette.

item.title: Takeaways From The Times’s Inside Look at the F.B.I.
item.description: Many current and former employees say Kash Patel’s first year as F.B.I. director was marred by vendettas, mismanagement and meltdowns.

item.title: Inside Kash Patel’s F.B.I.: Meltdowns, Chaos, Vendettas
item.description: Forty-five current and former employees on the changes they say are undermining the agency and making America less safe.

item.title: What Keeps Max Greyserman in Golf Obscurity? Less Than One Stroke Per Round.
item.description: He is ranked No. 33 in the world. Can he rise to the top by using lessons from his father’s time on Wall Street?
